causes: Spanish-American War and the Treaty of Paris (1898)
Cession of the Philippines from Spain to the United States
American desire to establish control over the Philippines
events_leading_up_to_war: Proclamation of Philippine independence by Emilio Aguinaldo in 1898
Arrival of American forces and establishment of military rule
Tensions between Filipino nationalists and American authorities

result.territorial_changes: Philippines becomes a territory of the United States

major_battles.name: Battle of Manila
major_battles.description: The first and largest battle of the war, resulting in a decisive American victory.

major_battles.name: Battle of Tirad Pass
major_battles.description: Filipino forces under Gregorio del Pilar attempted to delay American forces, resulting in his death and an American victory.

major_battles.name: Battle of Balangiga
major_battles.description: A surprise attack by Filipino guerrillas on American troops, resulting in significant American casualties.

impact_on_philippines: Significant loss of life and destruction of property
Introduction of new political and social systems

impact_on_united_states: Expansion of American influence in Asia
Debate over imperialism and its moral implications
Military experience and lessons learned in counterinsurgency

economic: Development of infrastructure and public works in the Philippines
Economic exploitation of Philippine resources by American businesses
political: Influence on future American foreign policy and imperialism
social: Introduction of American education and cultural practices
